required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of IMR-687 in Subjects With Sickle Cell Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2b Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of IMR-687 in Subjects With Sickle Cell Disease

brief_summary.textblock: A Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of IMR-687 in Subjects with Sickle Cell Disease

detailed_description.textblock: A phase 2b, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, multicenter study of subjects with sickle cell disease (SCD; homozygous sickle hemoglobin [HbSS], sickle-β0 [HbSB0] thalassemia, or sickle-β+ [HbSB+] thalassemia) to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the phosphodiesterase type 9 (PDE9) inhibitor, IMR-687, administered once daily (qd) for 52 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Subject response as defined by an increase of ≥3% in HbF
primary_outcome.description: a. Subject response in HbF (increase of ≥3%)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with adverse events and serious adverse events
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of Adverse Events Incidence of Serious Adverse Events

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 24, Week 36, and Week 52

secondary_outcome.measure: Subject response as defined by an increase of ≥3% in HbF
secondary_outcome.description: a) Subject response in HbF (increase of ≥3%)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 24, Week 36, and Week 52

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in hemolysis markers (% and absolute reticulocytes)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 24, Week 36, and Week 52

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect on indices of white blood cell (WBC) adhesion markers
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 24, Week 36, and Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: a) Change in WBC adhesion markers

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect on on the incidence of vaso-occlusive crises (VOCs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 24, Week 36, and Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: a) Change in the number of VOCs

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect on Quality of Life Measures: Adult Sickle Cell Quality of Life Measurement Information System (ASCQ-Me®)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 24, Week 36, and Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: a) Change in each measured subdomain of the Adult Sickle Cell Quality of Life Measurement Information System (ASCQ-Me®). The questions are ranked on a 5-point Likert Scale and there is one 11-point rating scale for pain intensity. High scores represent more of the domain being measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect on Quality of Measures: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurements Information System (PROMIS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 24, Week 36, and Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: a) The Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurements Information System Preference (PROMIS® 29 + 2 Profile v2.1 [PROPr] ). The questions are ranked on a 5-point Likert Scale and there is one 11-point rating scale for pain intensity. High scores represent more of the domain being measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect on Quality of Measures: Sickle Cell Self-Efficacy Scale (SCES)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Week 24, Week 36, and Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: 2) Change in overall score of the Sickle Cell Self-Efficacy Scale (SCSES). The SCES is a 9-item QoL. Responses range from "not at all sure" to "very sure".

arm_group.description: Oral administration of once daily IMR-687
Oral administration of once daily IMR-687
Oral administration of once daily Placebo

intervention.description: Oral administration of once daily IMR-687
Oral administration of once daily Placebo

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Confirmed diagnosis of SCD (HbSS, HbSB0 thalassemia, or HbSB+ thalassemia)
2. Hemoglobin of >5.5 and <10.5 g/dL.
3. Subjects must have had at least 1 and no more than 12 documented episodes of VOCs in the past 12 months at the time of informed consent signing and at randomization (Day 1).
4. Subjects receiving HU must have received it continuously for at least 6 months prior to signing informed consent, and must have been on a stable dose for at least 3 months prior to signing the informed consent, with no anticipated need for dose adjustments during the study including the screening period, in the opinion of the investigator.
5. Female subjects must not be pregnant or breastfeeding and be highly unlikely to become pregnant. Male subjects must be unlikely to impregnate a partner.
6. Must be willing and able to complete all study assessments and procedures, and to communicate effectively with the investigator and site staff.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Body mass index (BMI) <17.0 kg/m2 and a total body weight <45 kg; or a BMI >35 kg/m2.
2. Subjects with known active hepatitis A, hepatitis B, or hepatitis C, with active or acute event of malaria, or who are known to be positive for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).
3. Stroke requiring medical intervention within 24 weeks prior to randomization.
4. Prior exposure to IMR-687.
5. A history of use of crizanlizumab or voxelotor within 6 months prior to signing the informed consent.
6. Receipt of erythropoietin or other hematopoietic growth factor treatment within 3 months of signing the ICF or anticipated need for such agents during the study.
7. Prior gene therapy.
